meanings.definition: A strong, durable fabric used for making sails.
meanings.sent1: The sailcloths were carefully stitched together to create a new sail for the boat.
meanings.sent2: The sailors relied on high-quality sailcloths to navigate the rough seas.
meanings.sent3: When the sailcloths started singing sea shanties, the crew couldn't help but join in.
meanings.sent4: The billowing sailcloths in the wind resembled giant wings carrying the ship across the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The bright white sailcloths contrasted beautifully against the deep blue sky.

meanings.definition: The material used for constructing sails on a boat.
meanings.sent1: After inspecting the sailcloths, the captain decided they needed to be replaced before the next voyage.
meanings.sent2: The sailcloths fluttered in the wind as the boat picked up speed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull tried to steal a piece of the sailcloths for its nest.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the sailcloths glowed golden in the fading light.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the sailcloths told stories of past adventures on the open sea.
